A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. To find all quadratic residues modulo 7, we need to compute the squares of the integers from 0 to 6 (since 7 is the modulus) and then reduce them modulo 7.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 7)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 7)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
3^2 ≡ 9 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
4^2 ≡ 16 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
5^2 ≡ 25 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
6^2 ≡ 36 ≡ 1 (mod 7)

The quadratic residues modulo 7 are the unique values obtained from these computations: {0, 1, 2, 4}.
